Ang Yee Gary, Medicine at National University Of SingaporeLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 05 May 2019Firstly mature companies usually pay out dividends or buy back shares as they don't need money to grow.Investing in mature companies are generally safe unless their business are becoming sunset.
Growth companies at the extreme like uber, lyft are growing rapidly but losing money.Secondly, if the mature companies are not paying out dividends or buying back shares, sooner or later they will be debt free and cash rich
They are then at risk of being taking over by corporate raiders and thus they will overpay for silly companies to get rid of excess cash.0 comments0
